metadata.feature_description: Manages file extensions that should be excluded from indexing and crawling

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View list of all excluded extensions

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Search > File Extensions
steps.expected: File Extensions tab should display with Included and Excluded sections
steps.actual: File Extensions tab displayed with both Included and Excluded File Extensions sections

steps.action: View the Excluded File Extensions list
steps.expected: List of excluded extensions should be visible with delete buttons
steps.actual: List displayed showing .css, .eot, .htmtemplate, .ico, .rar, .template, .ttf, .woff, .xml, .xsd, .xsl with delete icons

steps.action: Click Add File Type button in Excluded section
steps.expected: Add form should appear with File Extension field
steps.actual: Add form appeared with File Extension textbox, Cancel and Save buttons

steps.expected: Extension should be saved and added to the list
steps.actual: Server returned HTTP 500 error on SaveExcludedFileExtension endpoint - extension was not added

issues: Server returned 500 Internal Server Error when attempting to save new excluded extension .testlog

steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared asking 'Are you sure you want to delete .xsl?' with No and Yes buttons

steps.expected: .xsl should be removed from the list
steps.actual: .xsl was successfully removed from the excluded extensions list

steps.action: Click Add File Type, enter .xsl (with leading dot)

steps.expected: .xsl should be added to the list
steps.actual: .xsl was successfully added to the excluded extensions list

steps.action: Attempt to add .xsl again (which already exists)
steps.expected: Validation error or duplicate warning should appear
steps.actual: Server returned HTTP 500 Internal Server Error instead of proper validation message

issues: Duplicate extension handling returns 500 server error instead of user-friendly validation message

steps.action: Click Add File Type and leave field empty
steps.expected: Validation should prevent saving empty value
steps.actual: Empty form shown before save attempt
Validation error displayed - text field shows red border with error icon

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add extension without leading dot (validation test)

steps.expected: Validation should require proper format with leading dot
steps.actual: Field shows red border with error icon indicating validation failure

steps.action: Attempt to save invalid extension format
steps.expected: Save should be prevented with validation error
steps.actual: Save prevented - validation error persists, extension not added

observations: The initial save attempt for .testlog extension failed with HTTP 500 error, but subsequent save for .xsl succeeded. This may indicate intermittent server issues or specific extension names may have restrictions.
Duplicate extension detection returns a server error (500) rather than a user-friendly validation message in the UI.
The system properly validates empty values and extension format (requires leading dot).
Delete functionality works correctly with confirmation dialog.
Extension formatting in the list consistently shows extensions with leading dot (e.g., .css, .xml).
